intro: Catharanthus pusillus, commonly known as the dwarf Madagascar periwinkle, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It is a small shrub that typically grows to a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of fragrant, violet-blue flowers throughout the year in its native habitat. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been studied for its potential medicinal properties.
